required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CD19 CAR-T Therapy for Elderly Patients With B-cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial for the Safety and Efficacy of CD19 CAR-T Therapy for Elderly Patients With B-cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: A Study of CD19 CAR-T Therapy for Elderly Patients With B-cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single arm, open-label, single-center study. This study is indicated for elderly patients with CD19+ non-Hodgkin's lymphoma. The selections of dose levels and the number of subjects are based on clinical trials of similar foreign products. 36 patients will be enrolled. Primary objective is to explore the safety, main consideration is dose-related safety.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days after CD19 targeted CAR T-cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events assessed according to NCI-CTCAE v5.0 criteria

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after CD19 targeted CAR T-cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events [Safety and Tolerability]

secondary_outcome.measure: B-cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma (B-NHL), Overall response rate (ORR)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of ORR (ORR = CR + CRi) at Month 6, 12, 18 and 24

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after CD19 CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: From the first infusion of CD19 CAR-T cells to death or the last visit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after CD19 CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: From the first infusion of CD19 CAR-T cells to the occurrence of any event, including death, relapse or generelapse,disease progression (any one occurs first), and the last visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life(EORTC QLQ-C30) Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment using European Organisation for the Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life QuestionnaireCore 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30) scale [For item1-28: max score: 112, min score: 28, higher scores mean a betteroutcome; for item 28-29: max score: 14, min score: 2, higher scores mean a worse outcome] to measure Quality of lifeat Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12
Assessment using Activities of Daily Living (ADL) scale (Barthel Index) [max score: 100, min score: 0, higher scoresmean a better outcome] at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL) score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL) scale [max score: 56, min score: 14, higher scores mean aworse outcome] at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment using Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) [max score: 42, min score: 0, higher scores mean aworse outcome] at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12

intervention.description: Each subject receive CD19 CAR T-cells by intravenous infusion

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital，College of Medicine, Zhejiang University
